description: Numbers n such that 15^n - 14^n is prime.
comments: Terms greater than 1000 may correspond to (unproven) strong pseudoprimes 15^n - 14^n. [Clarified by _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 16 2013]
author: _Mike Oakes_, May 18 2001, May 19 2001
extensions: New term 165559 found by Jean-Louis Charton in March 2011 corresponding to a probable prime with 194713 digits.
